intro: Corydalis cashmeriana var. brevicornu, commonly known as the Kashmir corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of delicate, pinkish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers bloom in early spring. This variant is noted for its ornamental value and is occasionally cultivated in gardens for its beauty.
